rule: If the chatbot is unable to determine the tag for the word, the output must be "CantAnswer".
input: He exclaimed with delight, huzzah!, huzzah
evaluation:
The output provided by the chatbot is "UH," which corresponds to the part of speech tag for "Interjection," as per the alphabetical list of part-of-speech tags provided in the description. Since the description requires returning only the part of speech tag or "Unknown" if the word cannot be tagged with the listed tags, or "CantAnswer" if unable to tag the word, the chatbot correctly provides a part of speech tag.

Without knowledge of the specific sentence and word that the chatbot was presented with, it is not possible to evaluate whether "UH" is the appropriate tag for that context. However, the description does not require correctness of the tag without knowing the input, only compliance with the output format which is present in this case.
